required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Long Term Follow-up Study for Patients Enrolled on the BP-004 Clinical Study
clinical_study.official_title: Follow-up of Phase 1/2 Study of CaspaCIDe T Cells (BPX-501) From an HLA-partially Matched Family Donor After Negative Selection of TCR αβ+T Cells in Pediatric Patients Affected by Hematological Disorders

brief_summary.textblock: This is a long-term follow up study evaluating the safety of BPX-501 T cells (rivogenlecleucel) and infused in pediatric patients previously enrolled on the BP-004 study.

detailed_description.textblock: Subjects enrolled on the BP-004 study who have completed 6 months active treatment with BPX-501 T-cells (rivogenlecleucel) will be requested to enroll on this long-term follow up protocol. Long term follow up for gene therapy clinical and safety endpoints will continue up to 15 years.

primary_outcome.description: Incidence of disease free survival at 2 years

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 15 years after rivogenlecleucel infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of delayed adverse events suspected to be related to rivogenlecleucel or rimiducid

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with replication competent retrovirus
secondary_outcome.time_frame: every 6 months after rivogenlecleucel infusion for 5 years and yearly thereafter for another 10 years
secondary_outcome.description: Presence of replication competent retrovirus in patient peripheral blood mononuclear cells measured by quantitative PCR

secondary_outcome.time_frame: every 6 months after rivogenlecleucel infusion for 5 years and yearly thereafter for another 10 years
secondary_outcome.description: Copy number of integrated retroviruses in patient peripheral blood mononuclear cells measured by quantitative PCR

arm_group.description: Rimiducid: to treat uncontrolled GVHD in patients who have received rivogenlecleucel Rimiducid will be given at 0.4 mg/kg weight (intravenous infusion) No further rivogenlecleucel infusions are planned. Patients who received rivogenlecleucel in the BP-004 study will be evaluated for long-term safety and efficacy.

intervention.description: Rimiducid is administered to treat chronic graft versus host disease
donor T-cells modified with iCasp safety switch

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Signed written informed consent by the patient or the patient's guardian for children who are minors
- Enrolled on BP-004 protocol, received BPX-501 infusion and completed 6 months of active treatment
Exclusion Criteria:
- Lack of parents'/guardian's informed consent for children who are minors
- Loss of allograft prior to 6 months
- Progression of malignant disease

facility.name: King Abdullah International Medical Research Center (KAIMRC)
Institute of Child Health & Great Ormond Street Hospital
